properties.media:imagetext:
This Winter Fly Around the Weather!
TWA NOW ADDS "SELECTED ROUTE FLYING"
TO ITS WINTER OPERATION...YOU FLY
WHEN AND WHERE THE WEATHER IS GOOD!
* SAN FRANCISCO
KANSAS CITY D
WICHITA
CHICAGO NE
FT. WAYNE
ST. LOUIS
DAYTON
INDIANAPOLIS
PHILADELPHIA
HARRISBURG
VEGAS
BOULDER DAM
CRAND CANYON
AMARILLO
OS ANGELES
PHOENIX.
Legend
I TWA REGULAR ROUTE
TWA OPTIONAL ROUTES
T WA - SHORTEST, FASTEST COAST TO COAST
THIS WINTER—as usual— TWA's con-
T servative policy is to Hy you when and
where the weather is good. In the past,
this has resulted in a high score of com-
pleted schedules. For TWA's route-
chosen by Colonel Lindbergh in 1927-is
nature-made for year-round flying.
However, no airline is entirely free from
temporary weather interruptions. So this
winter, with government approval, TWA
offers "Selected Route Flying." This
means TWA has a choice of several routes
that may be used as "weather detours."
What This Means To You
All weather is caused by "pressure areas."
They are always on the move at about 30
miles an hour in a general eastward direc-
tion. This means,
fortunately, that all
weather is both local and temporary.
With many routes to choose from, it's
easy for TWA to avoid weather delays-
to fly you around the weather rather than
through it.
No one knows these facts better than
TWA's flying management. Pilots them-
selves, they saw in "Selected Route Fly-
ing" another opportunity to make flying
more comfortable and dependable for you.
This winter, take advantage of "Select-
ed Route Flying" on The Airline Run by
Flyers. You'll agree it's air travel at its best!
Next trip, phone your travel agent or TWA.
TRANSCONTINENTAL
The Airline
(TWA
& WESTERN AIR, INC.
Run by Flyers
20
AS
